item.title: Keep Left Bollard, 13th July
item.description:

item.title: Flooding affecting crossing, 13th July
item.description:
This area of the road has once again flooded, leaving standing water regardless of the weather. This means that the pedestrian crossing is almost impossible to use and vehicles are changing lanes at very late notice to avoid splashing causing a risk of crashes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Manorway, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Human poo done outside flat intercom door, 13th July
item.description:
The whole block stinks of unpleasant human faeces. Someone has taken a dump outside the intercom door of flats 13-23 Hows street LONDON E2 8EE. Someone has deliberately done this and the whole block and quadrant stinks of unpleasant human poo.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hows Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wooden Bollards in Rain Garden damaged, 13th July
item.description:
Both Bollards , North and South of Melbourne Ave have been damaged by the clowns who park at the end of the street for their drug deals, and throw all their bottles, fag-ends and other rubbish into the gutter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Melbourne Avenue, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stops out of service because of road works, 13th July
item.description:
The 170 bus stops at Battersea High St have been out of service for several weeks because of road works. These are now complete - please restart the service as soon as possible please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vicarage Crescent, Battersea, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned refuse bin, 13th July

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Wootton Grove, Church End, London

item.title: Bags of rubbish left next to bin, 13th July
item.description:
Rubbish keeps getting left next to this bin and, as you can see in the photo, foxes spread the rubbish out all over the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hollydale Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in the Thames - east of Royal Arsenal, 13th July
item.description:
There are over a dozens of different bikes and well over a dozen trolleys dumped into The Thames. The number is increasing as, I assume, it is acceptable to do given the number that are already in the Thames. They seem to start east of the Royal Arsenal and continue along to Thamesmead. The largest concentration is near the place where I have placed the pin.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erebus Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Florence Road, Elmers End, London
